Question: In the UK survey entitled The Big Read carried out by the BBC in 2003, five of this person's books were named in the Top 100.
Hints: As a child, this person had walked past the house and dreamed of living in it.
Born in Portsmouth, England, this person left school to work in a factory after his father was thrown into debtors' prison.
Perhaps ****'s impressions on his meeting with Hans Christian Andersen informed the delineation of Uriah Heep.
